utmost.definition::
[n.] 极限；最大限度；最大量；最大可能
[adj.] 最大的；极度的
[网络] 最远的；极端的
utmost.example::
[1] No matter how much money it will cost, we must try our utmost to extend this girl's life who was infected by the HIV.
[2] We decided to do our utmost for a month, and produce a high quality product to prove our strength.
[3] Chan learned then that clarity of communication is of utmost importance, and that over-reassurance can be as bad as no reassurance at all.

conscience.definition::
[n.] 良心；良知；内疚；愧疚
[网络] 第三类法庭；道德心；没有良心
conscience.example::
[1] talk about intention, he wanted the United States red envelopes, wake up the conscience of the Wall Street rich.
[2] If a man has a bit of conscience, it always takes him when he's sober; and then it makes him low-spirited .
[3] He might suffer the least rudimentary twinge of conscience in whatever he did, and in just so far he was evil and sinning .

lamb.definition::
[n.] 羔羊；小羊；羊羔肉；（慈爱或怜悯地描述或称呼某人）宝贝
[v.] 产羊羔
[网络] 羊肉；羔羊肉；兰姆
lamb.example::
[1] I know I said we would have beef for dinner but I changed my mind at the butchers because lamb was on special offer.
[2] She began to cry and bleat fearfully, and the farmer came out to protect the lamb.
[3] Join Jack and Jill, Georgie Porgie, and Mary and her little lamb as they take a journey to King Cole's birthday party in London town.

trousers.definition::
[n.] 裤子
[v.] “trouser”的第三人称单数
[网络] 长裤；西裤；裤装
trousers.example::
[1] He held the wounded member carefully away from his side so that the blood would not drip upon his trousers.
[2] Read is henpecked by his wife. Mrs. Read wears the trousers in that family.
[3] The bottom of his trousers swayed heavily with his strides as they collected the dew from the dense grass and brush.

multiple.definition::
[adj.] 数量多的；多种多样的
[n.] 倍数
[网络] 多重的；复合的；多次
multiple.example::
[1] The name of an identifier contains multiple words and at least one of the words appears to be a compound word that is not cased correctly.
[2] Before content types can be added to a list or library, first the list or library must be set up to allow multiple content types.
[3] Since Ant allows multiple targets to be defined in one file, you can modify the file content and combine two or more files into one.

integrity.definition::
[n.] 完整；诚实正直；完好
[网络] 完整性；诚信；诚信正直
integrity.example::
[1] He says he is confident about his own integrity, and hopes the judicial system will quickly investigate the matter.
[2] But you are responsible for this particular creation and to that end, your artistic integrity must be at the core of every decision.
[3] One of their claims was that the company should respect the community's "cultural, organisational and territorial integrity" .

appreciate.definition::
[v.] 欣赏；感谢；感激；升值
[网络] 赏识；鉴赏；增值
appreciate.example::
[1] Enclosed my resume , and I will be appreciate if I can get a chance to talk with you face to face .
[2] He knew how much we loved the place and that we'd appreciate the years of work he and his wife had put into their home.
[3] I was just about to call to tell you how I appreciate the flowers you sent me.

gunpowder.definition::
[n.] 火药
[网络] 黑色火药；有烟火药；珠茶
gunpowder.example::
[1] What the British did not realise was that Washington simply did not have the gunpowder required to fire the cannons.
[2] and, for the space of half a year, the gunpowder lay as harmless as sand, because no fire came near to explode it.
[3] The formula of the gunpowder was first discovered by Taoist alchemists of ancient China when trying to make pills of immortality.

ascertain.definition::
[v.] 查明；弄清
[网络] 确定；发现；打听清楚
ascertain.example::
[1] Identities of the 19 injured have been confirmed, and police are still trying to ascertain the identities of the dead.
[2] We conducted our own, entirely unscientific, survey to ascertain just how much chocolate Nobel laureates ate.
[3] The school that my daughter attends is trying to decide whether or not to ascertain books, which some parents think are inappropriate.

theirs.definition::
[pron.] 他们的
[网络] 他们的东西；它们的；她们的
theirs.example::
[1] Although gifts are placed under the tree on Christmas Eve for the children, parents and adults do not exchange theirs until New Year's Day.
[2] Just watch out, if your co-workers notice you getting good at it they're likely to start asking for to help with theirs!
[3] So it is alarmed that peasants living close to cities have increasingly been behaving as if the land is theirs anyway.

slipper.definition::
[n.] 拖鞋
[v.] (用拖鞋)打(孩子等)；穿着拖鞋走
[网络] 便鞋；滑块；拖鞋式
slipper.example::
[1] However, if she became the dominant partner, neighbours transferred the power of the slipper to her, and christened her "the old boot" .
[2] The slipper was put at the bed head on his side of the bed to remind his wife who was boss.
[3] We'd like to sign a sole agency agreement with you on your slipper for a period of three years.

trick.definition::
[n.] 技巧；诡计；诀窍；把戏
[v.] 欺骗；欺诈
[adj.] 意在欺骗的；容易使人上当的；虚弱有毛病的
[网络] 恶作剧；圈套；戏法
trick.example::
[1] When you know how the card trick itself is done, you feel like a fool for falling for it.
[2] One of the best ways to trick your mind is to simply take it out of the equation.
[3] The company is now trying to pull off a similar trick with tea in the Middle East.

dump.definition::
[v.] 倾倒；抛售；抛弃；转存
[n.] 垃圾场；转储；转存；废物堆
[网络] 倾销；倾卸；垃圾堆
dump.example::
[1] A dump creates a record of every object in the heap, how much memory it's using, and which objects are referencing it.
[2] The absence of any of these four factors should be a red flag that the so-called report could really be a pump and dump marketing ploy.
[3] If you think you're going to be able to dump your most mundane assignments onto the people who report to you, think again.

recruit.definition::
[n.] 新兵；新警员；新成员
[v.] 吸收（新成员）；征募（新兵）；动员…（提供帮助）；（通过招募）组成
[网络] 招聘；招收；补充
recruit.example::
[1] It's been a mad year for investment banks trying to recruit in Asia.
[2] During the programme, one recruit was secretly filmed yelling "Paki" as he plunged his bayonet into a target dummy.
[3] "He said to us, if we are able to recruit people, then fine, " she said, "but he didn't approve, and he told people not to participate. "

winter.definition::
[n.] 冬季；冬天
[adj.] 冬天的；越冬的；冬播的
[v.] 过冬
[网络] 温特；冬装；寒冬
winter.example::
[1] In winter it felt like a barn, he had to wear a heavy coat and put his feet in a box to keep warm.
[2] In this inexplicable fear, the only snow of the winter that's happy to re-ignite the fire of my hope, I feel perfect security.
[3] The winter snow, in fact, should not be part of the winter snow in the winter is only a decoration, a decoration, a fleeting scenery.

perception.definition::
[n.] 感知；知觉；看法；洞察力
[网络] 感觉；认知；理解
perception.example::
[1] This perception, visible in the UK as well, has obvious racist foundations but does not always represent racism in its purest form.
[2] The humans do not start from that direct perception of Him which we, unhappily, cannot avoid.
[3] If I had not adopted the mysterious implication, that meant I was deficient in the perception of life.

murmur.definition::
[n.] 低语；咕哝；喃喃声；嘟囔
[v.] 低语；喃喃细语；连续发出低沉的声音；（私下）发怨言
[网络] 杂音；低声说；姆尔姆尔
murmur.example::
[1] The Toad was so anxious not to be left out that he took up the inferior position assigned to him without a murmur, and the animals set off.
[2] The old man drooped his head and began to murmur to himself my father's name. Suddenly he looked up.
[3] When he say we is trying to make a fool of him, I can only murmur that the creator have beat us to it.

sway.definition::
[n.] 影响；摇摆；摆动；统治
[v.] 摇动；说服；使相信；使动摇
[网络] 倾斜；摇晃；支配
sway.example::
[1] But, as I've learned, logic has its limits. It's the heart not the head that governs this world under the sway of the dizzy gods.
[2] How did he come to hold such sway with a public that had begun to distrust both the establishment government and the establishment media?
[3] Hank looked around, ran to open poncho to keep the wind and rain in a delicate flowers sway in the wind above.

crisp.definition::
[adj.] 脆的；酥脆的；鲜脆的；脆嫩的
[n.] 炸薯片（有多种风味，袋装）；水果酥
[v.] （使）变脆
[网络] 易碎的；活泼青脆的；松脆的
crisp.example::
[1] Stronger adhesion: Coating of UV craft is too thick. It is crisp, not flexible, and easy to be broken off.
[2] Terri Crisp, dog in hand, got out of her car and walked right up to our camera and acted like she was about to answer our questions.
[3] After a while, a crisp chime was heard in the distance, followed by the chanting of sutras . The man seemed to wake from his reverie.

fatal.definition::
[adj.] 致命的；灾难性的；毁灭性的；导致失败的
[网络] 致命错误；致命错误信息；致死的
fatal.example::
[1] Spontaneous omental hemorrhage without vasculopathy is extremely rare but is often a fatal event.
[2] Nobody knows how much probability there is that the unrecoverable and fatal accidents with a tiny possibility happen to you or me.
[3] Authorities say St. Louis Cardinals pitcher Josh Hancock was drunk and talking on his cell phone at the time of his fatal crash on Sunday.
